metadata.title: Chicken Jhal Chachhori | চিকেন ঝাল চচ্চড়ি | Bengali recipe
metadata.description: Chicken Jhal Chachhori (চিকেন ঝাল চচ্চড়ি) is a traditional Bengali chicken recipe featured on the Rural Recipes YouTube channel, showcasing rural culinary heritage from Bononabagram, East Burdwan, by Reena Mukherjee. The video documents local cooking traditions and village life, highlighting a lesser-known chicken variation of the chachhori dish. #BengaliFood #ChickenRecipe #RuralRecipes

transcription_bengali: [00:00:20] কয়েক বছর আগে এখানে বননবাগ্রাম বাউল আশ্রম তৈরি হয়েছে।
[00:00:25] বাউল গান শুনে বসে থাকার জন্য এটা দারুণ একটা জায়গা।
[00:00:31] আশ্রমে রান্নার দায়িত্বে রয়েছেন নীলু ঠাকুর।
[00:00:34] নীলু ঠাকুরের রুমাল আর বইয়ের ব্যাগটা আমার খুব পছন্দ।
[00:00:39] সকালের চায়ে আমি তাঁর স্ত্রীর রান্নার গল্প শুনলাম।
[00:00:45] একজন ঘরোয়া গৃহবধূর গল্প শুনে খুবই ভালো লাগলো।
[00:00:51] তাই সিদ্ধান্ত নিলাম রীণা মুখার্জির রান্না দিয়েই আমার প্রথম ভ্লগ শুরু করব।
[00:01:25] আপনার বিয়ে কত বছর বয়সে হয়েছিল?
[00:01:42] আপনি কি এখানে রান্না শিখেছিলেন? হ্যাঁ, এখানেই শিখেছিলাম।
[00:01:50] আমার পিসি এখানে ঠাকুর হতেন। উনিই আমাকে সব শিখিয়েছিলেন।
[00:02:08] রীণাদি, আজ আমাদের জন্য কী রান্না করছেন?
[00:02:19] মাছ আর সবজির চচ্চড়ির কথা শুনেছি, কিন্তু চিকেনেরটা শুনিনি।
[00:02:31] তারপর হলুদ গুঁড়ো, লঙ্কা গুঁড়ো, জিরে গুঁড়ো আর ধনে গুঁড়ো দিই।
[00:02:36] রসুন প্রস্তুত করা হয়েছে আর পেঁয়াজ কাটা হয়েছে।
[00:02:48] তেল দেওয়া হয়। আমি সাদা তেল ব্যবহার করি, তবে সর্ষের তেলও ব্যবহার করা যায়।
[00:05:50] রুটি আর পরোটার সঙ্গে খুব ভালো লাগে।
[00:06:07] রান্না হতে প্রায় আধ ঘণ্টা লেগেছে।
[00:06:16] বাড়িতে অবশ্যই একবার চেষ্টা করে দেখবেন।
[00:06:24] আমরা এটা নীলু ঠাকুরকে পরিবেশন করব।
[00:07:59] এভাবেই খাবারের মাধ্যমে মানুষের পরিচয় হয়।
transcription_english: [00:00:16] Today I have come to Ausgram in Bardhaman.
[00:00:20] A few years ago, the Bononabagram Baul Ashram was built here.
[00:00:25] It’s a wonderful place to sit and listen to Baul music.
[00:00:31] Nilu Thakur is in charge of cooking at the ashram.
[00:00:33] I’ve heard he lives nearby.
[00:00:34] I really like Nilu Thakur’s handkerchief and book bag.
[00:00:39] Over morning tea, I heard the story of his wife’s cooking.
[00:00:45] It was fascinating to hear the story of a traditional homemaker.
[00:00:51] So I decided to begin my first vlog with the cooking of Reena Mukherjee.
[00:01:08] Reena-di is performing puja at Thakur’s house.
[00:01:17] We have come to Reena-di’s home.
[00:01:19] Reena-di is Nilu Thakur’s mother-in-law.
[00:01:23] Reena-di, do you know everything?
[00:01:25] How old were you when you got married?
[00:01:29] I was 17 years old when I got married.
[00:01:38] My parental home is in Ramchandrapur village.
[00:01:42] Did you learn cooking here? Yes, I learned to cook here.
[00:01:50] My aunt used to serve Thakur here. She taught me everything.
[00:02:08] Reena-di, what are you cooking for us today?
[00:02:11] Chicken Jhal Chachhori.
[00:02:19] We’ve heard of fish and vegetable chachhori, but not chicken.
[00:02:21] First, we add soaked mustard seeds.
[00:02:28] Then we add soaked poppy seeds.
[00:02:31] Then turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder.
[00:02:36] Garlic has been prepared and onions have been chopped.
[00:02:48] Oil is added. I use refined/white oil, but mustard oil can also be used.
[00:03:12] Onions are added.
[00:03:15] Ginger-garlic paste is added.
[00:03:47] Now the chicken is added.
[00:03:51] A little salt is added.
[00:04:07] Potatoes are added.
[00:04:21] The prepared spice mixture is added.
[00:04:35] Turmeric powder is added.
[00:04:45] Cumin powder is added.
[00:04:55] Everything is ground in a mixer.
[00:05:09] Mustard and poppy seeds are added.
[00:05:17] Salt is adjusted.
[00:05:24] Chopped coriander leaves are added.
[00:05:31] This is the final step of cooking.
[00:05:42] The Chicken Jhal Chachhori tastes amazing.
[00:05:50] It goes very well with roti and paratha.
[00:06:07] It took about half an hour to cook.
[00:06:16] You should definitely try it at home.
[00:06:24] We will serve it to Nilu Thakur.
[00:06:58] Nilu Thakur tastes the dish.
[00:07:13] It is very good.
[00:07:49] Nilu Thakur is very happy today.
[00:07:59] This is how people get introduced through food.
[00:08:01] See you in the next episode.
[00:08:06] Everyone, be well.
